meanings.definition: An act of delivering a speech or discourse to an audience.
meanings.sent1: During the lecture, the professor explained the topic in detail.
meanings.sent2: The lecture at the conference was informative and engaging.
meanings.sent3: The lecture about dinosaurs made the kids excited to learn more.
meanings.sent4: Her lecture on environmental conservation was like a beacon of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The lecture on space exploration left a lasting impression on the students.

meanings.definition: To give a formal talk to a group of people.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys lecturing about history to the students.
meanings.sent2: The professor will be lecturing on economics next week.
meanings.sent3: He was lecturing so passionately that he almost forgot the time.
meanings.sent4: The expert was lecturing as if sharing secrets of the trade.
meanings.sent5: Lecturing on art history, she captured the audience's attention effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To scold or reprimand someone in a long-winded manner.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was lecturing the students for not completing their homework.
meanings.sent2: She lectured her brother for leaving the door unlocked.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be lecturing the dog for making a mess.
meanings.sent4: He felt like he was lecturing a brick wall when talking to his stubborn friend.
meanings.sent5: The boss was lecturing the employees about punctuality in the workplace.
